referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Multiplication
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Substraction
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to tow a caravan with a person riding in the caravan?
options: Make sure you have a street directory, so you know where you are going.
Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.
Have a large meal and a cup of coffee
Have a large meal and a cup of coffee.
Make sure you have a street directory, so you know where you are going.
Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.
questions.qn: Before driving a long distance at fast speed or carrying a full car load, you should -
If an oncoming vehicle crosses the centre line and is coming straight at you and you cannot stop, you should -
options: Drive onto the wrong side of the road and hope the other vehicle does not do the same.
Slow down and hope that the driver will turn away.
Brake, look for room to the left, sound your horn and flash your lights.
Only need to report the accident to the Police if someone was injured.
Must report the accident to the Police Station nearest to where the accident happened within 24 hours.
Do not need to report the accident to the Police.
questions.qn: If you are involved in an accident where your vehicle needs to be towed away and the Police does not attend the crash scene, you -

options: You must let them see your licence, take details, and give the name and address of the vehicle's owner.
No details at all until you have contacted your insurance company
Only your name and address details if a Policeman asks for them.
questions.qn: If your vehicle is involved in an accident (regardless of the damage), what details must you give, to the other driver(s), if asked?

options: Report the accident to Police within seven days.
Only call the Police if the accident also resulted in over $500 worth of property damage.
Render every assistance and take immediate steps to have an ambulance notified. Then call the Police.
questions.qn: If a vehicle you are driving is involved in an accident and a person is injured, what must you do after stopping?

options: Trains are fast, heavy and cannot stop quickly.
Pedestrians might be crossing.
Car brakes often fail.
questions.qn: Stop signs or flashing lights at railway crossings should always be obeyed, because -

options: You are towing a caravan.
Traffic is blocking the other side.
A station is nearby.
questions.qn: You should not drive across a railway level crossing when -

options: You are about to stop.
You intend to slow down.
You intend to move to the right, at any time.
questions.qn: You should use your right-hand indicator when

options: Stop and check the traffic behind you on the entrance.
Look for a large enough break in the traffic and adjust your speed so as to fit into the traffic flow.
Sound your horn, turn on your indicator lights and move onto the freeway.
questions.qn: When merging onto the freeway from the entrance, you should-

options: Slow down and watch for traffic controllers and instructions.
Stop immediately and wait for instructions.
Maintain the same speed.
questions.qn: If you see a sign indicating road repairs are going on, you should -

options: Bicycle riders must ride along the yellow line.
You may at any time, park along this part of the road for 1 hour only.
Clearway restrictions apply - you must not stop during the clearway hours.
questions.qn: You see a broken yellow line painted on the roadway adjacent to the kerb. What does it mean?

options: Speed up to pass the horse.
Slow down and give them plenty of room.
Sound your horn to warn the rider.
questions.qn: If you see a horse and rider on the road what should you do?

options: A small bus licence.
A heavy rigid vehicle licence.
A car licence.
questions.qn: A friend lends you a van that has seats for ten passengers. What type of licence do you need to drive this type of vehicle?

options: Once you become aware of the condition you must notify the RTA.
Hand your licence in at the nearest police station.
Tell your doctor and let him or her notify the RTA.
questions.qn: What are you required to do if you develop a serious medical condition that could affect your driving?

options: Stop until red lights stop flashing then drive on if it is safe to do so.
Slow down and drive carefully over the crossing if you cannot see a train approaching.
Stop until train has passed then proceed immediately.
questions.qn: If the red lights on this sign are flashing what are you required to do?

options: You are approaching an intersection with traffic lights, be prepared to stop.
You are approaching a school or playground.
A give way sign at an intersection is ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop.
questions.qn: You should expect this sign, if-

options: Slow down and beware of trucks entering from the side.
Trucks must use low gear
Heavy vehicle checking station ahead
questions.qn: You should expect this sign, if -

options: Stop and help aged pedestrians across the road.
Hospital ahead, slow down and proceed with caution.
Slow down and look out for pedestrians crossing the road ahead.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Overhead footbridge for pedestrians ahead.
Pedestrian crossing ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop.
Joggers ahead, drive carefully.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: If a one way street is ahead.
If a one lane bridge is ahead.
When a divided road ends and two way traffic is ahead.
questions.qn: You should expect this sign -

options: Children's playground ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop.
Do not litter
Workers ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You are approaching a children's playground, slow down
Watch out for bicycle riders along the roadway or when turning.
Bicycle riders not allowed on the roadway.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: If traffic lights are out of order or the amber light is flashing, you must stop and give way to traffic as if you are at an intersection  with stop signs.
Stop at all times and give way to all traffic.
Stop, red light camera in operation.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You are approaching a roundabout, prepare to give way
One way traffic ahead.
Stop sign ahead, slow down and prepare to stop.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Exercising and drinking black coffee.
Buying a breathalyser (alcohol measuring instrument).
Not drinking any alcohol.
questions.qn: What is the safest way to stay under the legal alcohol limit?

options: Zero.
questions.qn: If you hold a learner or provisional licence class what is the Blood Alcohol Concentration (BAC) limit?

options: Find out from your doctor or chemist whether the medicine or drug will affect your driving and act accordingly.
Only drive during the day after taking the medicine or drug.
Only drive a motor car not a heavy vehicle.
questions.qn: If you are taking any sort of medicine, you should -

options: Have some food in your stomach.
Plan to have some other person with you.
Know what the effects of the drug are.
questions.qn: Before taking any drugs and then driving it is most important to -

options: Can make a U turn provided it is safe to do so.
Can go straight ahead, or turn left or turn right, if it is safe to do so.
Must stop and wait for the red light before proceeding.
questions.qn: This light means, you -

options: Not turn right while the arrow is red
Turn right when you have waited one minute
Turn right if it is safe to do so.
questions.qn: It is 3 o'clock in the morning. You cannot see any other traffic. You want to turn right. You may -

options: Only if it is turned on.
No matter what your reason is.
If you purchased it after 1998.
questions.qn: Having a radar detector or jammer in your car is against the law -

options: There are street lights along the road.
The road you are driving on is gravel.
There's an emergency, which mean speed limits don't apply.
questions.qn: Where there are no speed limit signs, the speed limit is 100 km/h, unless -

options: Drive at 10 km/h if there are pedestrians around.
Share this road with other people and vehicles and not exceed 10 km/h.
Reduce your speed to what you think is safe but never below 10 km/h.
questions.qn: This sign means you must -

options: In the front seat.
In the back seat.
In the front seat sharing your seat belt.
questions.qn: You are driving a vehicle that only has a seat belt for the driver. To reduce the danger of being in a vehicle without a seat belt, where is the best place for passengers to sit?

options: Tell them the car has seat belts and they should wear them.
Say nothing because it's the passengers' responsibility to wear their seat belts.
Drive slower than you normally would so the passengers are safe.
questions.qn: When passengers get in the car and do not put their seat belts on, the safest thing to do is -

options: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
questions.qn: When reversing, you should -

options: May not travel on heavy traffic roads.
Must obey the road rules.
Must ride against the flow of traffic so they can be seen.
questions.qn: Which one of the following statements is correct? Bicycle riders -

options: Slow down, and be ready to make a safe stop.
Sound your horn to warn them of your presence.
Continue at the same speed and drive around them.
questions.qn: When driving near children playing or walking near the edge of the road, you should

options: Yes, a driver turning right or left must give way to pedestrians, if there is a danger of a collision
Yes, only if turning left.
Yes, only if turning right.
questions.qn: If turning at an intersection are you required to give way to pedestrians?

options: Travel into the intersection and wait until traffic ahead moves.
Proceed if there is no traffic on your right.
Wait until there is room for you to completely cross the intersection.
questions.qn: When you come to an intersection and the road beyond is choked with vehicles going in the same direction, what should you do?

options: Less time you need to overtake.
More distance and time you need to overtake
Closer you must get before starting to overtake.
questions.qn: The faster the vehicle in front of you is travelling, the -

options: Wait for a better opportunity with more distance to overtake.
Put the vehicle in a lower gear and speed up.
Sound your horn to signal the driver ahead to slow down.
questions.qn: If you are not sure you have enough distance to overtake a vehicle ahead, you should -

options: Flash your headlights to warn other drivers.
Turn your headlights on high beam.
Turn on your headlights, slow down, and double your following distance behind the vehicle in front.
questions.qn: In wet weather when it becomes hard for you to see, you should -

options: Put your hazard warning lights on and increase your speed to avoid the rain.
Put your lights on high beam so you can see better.
Slow down using the brake gently, since rain and oil may create a slippery surface.
questions.qn: If you are driving and it starts to rain, you should -
